docs.text: W.I.P.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Collaborations This list does not claim to be complete. Science thrives on interdisciplinarity and cooperation, and listed here, among many other great scientists, are those with whom we currently cooperate a lot. Systems Medicine of Infectious Disease, Robert Koch Institute, Berlin ( Max von Kleist ) Data Analytics and Computational Statistics, Hasso Plattner Institute, Potsdam ( Bernhard Renard ) Institute for Infectious Diseases and Infection Control, Cloud computing and sequencing, University Hospital, Jena ( Christian Brandt ) Institute for Medical Microbiology and Virology, University Hospital, Leipzig ( Adrian Viehweger ) Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences, Department of Molecular Sciences, Uppsala ( Volkmar Passoth, Bettina Müller ) Institute of Virology, University Hospital, Freiburg ( Jonas Fuchs ) RNA Bioinformatics and High-Throughput Analysis, Friedrich Schiller University, Jena ( Manja Marz, Konrad Sachse ) We are member of the European Virus Bioinformatics Center .
docs.title: Collaborations

Systems Medicine of Infectious Disease, Robert Koch Institute, Berlin ( Max von Kleist ) Data Analytics and Computational Statistics, Hasso Plattner Institute, Potsdam ( Bernhard Renard ) Institute for Infectious Diseases and Infection Control, Cloud computing and sequencing, University Hospital, Jena ( Christian Brandt ) Institute for Medical Microbiology and Virology, University Hospital, Leipzig ( Adrian Viehweger ) Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences, Department of Molecular Sciences, Uppsala ( Volkmar Passoth, Bettina Müller ) Institute of Virology, University Hospital, Freiburg ( Jonas Fuchs ) RNA Bioinformatics and High-Throughput Analysis, Friedrich Schiller University, Jena ( Manja Marz, Konrad Sachse ) We are member of the European Virus Bioinformatics Center .
docs.title: Collaborations

docs.text: Projects We are always looking for motivated students to join the group. We have many projects and ideas for assistants, internships, and bachlor/master theses in areas such as: De novo hybrid assembly Metagenomics & -transcriptomics Prokaryotic annotation pipelining High-throughput data visualization Bioinformatics workflow management systems Pathogen detection & virus bioinformatics Outbreak analysis & pathogen evolution Long-read analysis & real-time sequencing Genomic surveillance of pathogens Please contact us directly for more details.
docs.title: Projects

docs.text: Tools & Pipelines Most of our pipelines need only Nextflow and Docker or Conda installed. Thanks to all co-authors, developers, contributors and users! poreCov An easy to use, fast, and robust workflow for SARS-CoV-2 genome reconstruction via Nanopore amplicon sequencing. Developed in cooperation with the CaSe group . nextflow run replikation/poreCov -r 0 .11.1 -profile test_fastq,local,docker Publication GitHub RNAflow A simple RNA-Seq differential gene expression pipeline using Nextflow. For a test run, please try: nextflow run hoelzer-lab/rnaflow -r v1.1.0 -profile test,local,docker Publication GitHub RIBAP R oary I LP B acterial A nnotation P ipeline RIBAP combines sequence homology information from Roary with smart pairwise ILP calculations to produce a more complete bacterial core gene set. nextflow run hoelzer-lab/ribap \ -r 0 .5.0 --help RIBAP was already used in Vorimore et al. (2021) and Hölzer et al. (2020) . GitHub Currently under heavy development, so expect some bugs but feel free to report issues . PoSeiDon Po sitive Se lect i on D etecti on and recombination analysis of protein-coding genes. nextflow run hoelzer/poseidon -r 1 .0.2 --help Publication GitHub
docs.title: Tools

docs.text: Most of our pipelines need only Nextflow and Docker or Conda installed. Thanks to all co-authors, developers, contributors and users!
docs.title: Tools & Pipelines

docs.text: An easy to use, fast, and robust workflow for SARS-CoV-2 genome reconstruction via Nanopore amplicon sequencing. Developed in cooperation with the CaSe group . nextflow run replikation/poreCov -r 0 .11.1 -profile test_fastq,local,docker Publication GitHub
docs.title: poreCov

docs.text: A simple RNA-Seq differential gene expression pipeline using Nextflow. For a test run, please try: nextflow run hoelzer-lab/rnaflow -r v1.1.0 -profile test,local,docker Publication GitHub
docs.title: RNAflow

docs.text: R oary I LP B acterial A nnotation P ipeline RIBAP combines sequence homology information from Roary with smart pairwise ILP calculations to produce a more complete bacterial core gene set. nextflow run hoelzer-lab/ribap \ -r 0 .5.0 --help RIBAP was already used in Vorimore et al. (2021) and Hölzer et al. (2020) . GitHub Currently under heavy development, so expect some bugs but feel free to report issues .
docs.title: RIBAP

docs.text: Po sitive Se lect i on D etecti on and recombination analysis of protein-coding genes. nextflow run hoelzer/poseidon -r 1 .0.2 --help Publication GitHub

docs.text: function makeGraph(container, labels) { container = document.getElementById(container); labels = document.getElementById(labels) var dnl = container.getElementsByTagName("li"); for(var i = 0; i < dnl.length; i++) { var item = dnl.item(i); var value = item.innerHTML; var color = item.style.background=color; var content = value.split(":"); value = content[0]; item.style.height=value + "px"; item.style.top=(199 - value) + "px"; item.style.left = (i * 50 + 20) + "px"; item.style.height = value + "px"; item.innerHTML = value; item.style.visibility="visible"; color = content[2]; if(color != false) item.style.background=color; labels.innerHTML = labels.innerHTML + /*"" +*/ "" + content[1] + ""; } } window.onload=function () { makeGraph("graph", "labels") } Head Martin Hölzer PhD Email Google Scholar ORCID GitHub Martin is deputy head of the Bioinformatics unit and responsible for research in the BIR team. His expertise is in RNA-Seq, metagenomics, nanopore sequencing, virus detection, nextflow and containerization. He is PI of the project team Positive selection and pathogen evolution .
docs.title: Martin
